name: Tableau Open Source Projects
body:
## Contributing Code to Tableau Projects
Many Tableau projects accept pull requests (check a given project's README) for bug fixes and for new features.

### Submitting a Bug Fix or New Feature
Before a pull request (PR) will be accepted:
* There must be an open, approved issue for tracking the bug or feature.
* The PR must contain a link to the bug/features's issue.
* You must have signed a Contributor License Agreement (discussed below).

For any new features, the project team will have an open discussion (including you) about the design. New features will be accepted based on alignment with the project direction, impact (positive and negative), and serviceability.

## Contributor License Agreement (CLA)
Before we accept a PR, you must have signed a CLA. What is a CLA? It's a legal agreement that gives us permission to use the code you submit. You only need to sign the CLA one time.

There are two flavors of CLA document: one [for individuals](./2016.01-TableauIndividualCLA.pdf) and another [for organizations](./2016.01-TableauCorpCLA.pdf)

To sign the agreement electronically, please [email us](mailto:github@tableau.com?subject=Tableau%20CLA%20Request&body=Dear%20Tableau%2C%0A%0AI%20am%20%3Cor%20We%20are%3E%20interested%20in%20contributing%20%3Csomething%3E%20to%20the%20%3Cproject%3E%20repository.%20Please%20send%20me%20the%20%3Cindividual%20or%20group%3E%20CLA%20document%20to%20e-sign.%0A%0ASincerely%2C%0A%0A%3Cyou%3E) and we'll send it to you (this is our preferred method :heart:).

You may also send us a signed agreement via :email:, :mailbox:, or :fax:. See the agreement for more info.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
